items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Penetrating Cold Powers Physical Natural Gas to Winter Highs
items.summary: Spot gas prices pushed even higher on Friday, continuing a week-long trend galvanized by harsh winter weather and widespread expectations for robust heating needs through the end of the month.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Finishes Furious Trading Week on High Note
items.summary: The natural gas futures market on Friday capped a holiday-shortened week of massive gains with a fourth consecutive daily advance, bolstered by forecasts for the coldest final week of January of this decade.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Henry Hub Cash Tops $28 Ahead of  Bone-Chilling Weekend
items.summary: Spot natural gas prices for weekend delivery posted eye-watering gains as traders assessed the potential for record-breaking production freeze-offs, widespread power outages and a gargantuan spike in residential heating demand caused by Winter Storm

items.title: Natural Gas Export Cutbacks Could Act as Safety Valve for Markets Amid Winter Storm Fern
items.summary: Icy and subfreezing forecasts along the Gulf Coast LNG corridor have analysts watching whether Winter Storm Fern could force export facilities to curtail operations, a scenario that could free up natural gas supply for domestic markets even as freeze

items.title: Alaska LNG Pipeline Moves Toward Build Phase as Glenfarne Lines up Contractors, Feed Gas
items.summary: Glenfarne Group LLC, developer of the Alaska LNG export project, is transitioning from planning to building the first phase of a massive pipeline with a flurry of construction and supply deals, according to the company.

items.title: Shell, Mitsubishi Said Exploring LNG Canada Sale as Companies Reshuffle Portfolios
items.summary: Shell plc and Mitsubishi Corp. are reportedly gauging the market’s appetite for buying an interest in their stakes in the LNG export terminal.

items.title: Winter Storm Fern Sends Natural Gas Forward Prices Higher With Northeast Gains at Top
items.summary: Severe winter forecasts propelled natural gas forward prices during the Jan. 15–21 trading period as some of the coldest weather in 80 years appeared poised to touch nearly every corner of the country.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Seeking Direction Ahead of Weekend Deep Freeze
items.summary: After a raucous weeklong rally, February natural gas futures lurched between both sides of even as life-threatening cold enveloped large swaths of the Lower 48, and traders dug in for a potentially make-or-break weekend.

items.title: DOE Preps for Blackouts as Deep Freeze Risks Match Uri, Elliott Impacts, Natural Gas Production Plunges
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) called on grid operators this week to make backup power generation resources available at data centers and other major facilities to prevent blackouts as the coldest weather in decades sweeps the country.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Canadian Gas Prices Surge on Arctic Cold, LNG Feed Gas Demand
items.summary: Canada’s natural gas prices surged despite rising rig counts that signaled strong production, as frigid weather-driven demand and higher LNG feed gas flows combined to underpin the move.

items.title: Venezuela’s Heavy Oil Gets a Lifeline from US Naphtha
items.summary: US naphtha has begun arriving in Venezuelan waters, marking an early and telling step in efforts to restart the country’s long-crippled heavy oil production. Ship tracking data showed a tanker chartered by Vitol reaching Venezuelan waters with the fi

items.title: Azerbaijan Promises More Gas to Europe as Production Reality Lags
items.summary: The Azerbaijani state energy company SOCAR has announced it is selling natural gas to Austria and Germany. But it remains an open question whether Baku can hit its promised target of delivering 20 billion cubic meters (bcm) of gas to the European Uni

items.title: U.S. Oil Drillers Add One Rig as Winter Weather Sets In
items.summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States rose by 1 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, bringing the total rig count in the US  to 544 this week, down 32 from this same time last

items.title: Geopolitics Override Fundamentals as Oil Extends 2026 Rally
items.summary: Oil prices climbed after President Trump’s Iran rhetoric revived geopolitical risk, pushing Brent above $66 despite limited supply disruption impact.   Friday, January 23, 2026 Kazakhstan’s incessant supply disruptions have been the main talking poin

items.title: Europe’s Gas Storage Is Draining at the Fastest Pace in Five Years
items.summary: Below-average winter temperatures are driving the fastest pace of withdrawals from natural gas storage in Europe in five years, as heating demand is rising. EU gas storage sites were only 47% full as of January 21, according to the latest data from G
